src:
Falsk alarm f√∏rte til full utrykking p√• Schiphol i Amsterdam
En flyger som trykket p√• feil knapp, bidro til full utrykking p√• Schiphol lufthavn i Amsterdam onsdag kveld. Flyselskapet Air Europa beklager dypt.
06 Nov 2019, 18:52 by NTB-AFP-AP



Et fly venter p√• √• ta av fra Amsterdams lufthavn Schiphol Airport etter at alarmen gikk onsdag kveld. üì∑ Foto: Giorgio Bonfiglio / AP / NTB scanpix Galleri



Nederlandsk politi p√• Schiphol etter at det ved en feiltakelse ble utl√∏st en alarm om bord i et fly fra Air Europa. üì∑ Foto: Peter Dejong / AP / NTB scanpix Galleri


Etter halvannen time med ubekreftede meldinger om at det muligens p√•gikk en gisselsituasjon om bord p√• et fly, kom beskjeden om at alle passasjerene og mannskapet var i sikkerhet.
Like etter sendte det spanske flyselskapet Air Europa ut en beklagelse p√• Twitter.
‚Äì Falsk alarm. P√• flyvingen fra Amsterdam til Madrid ble det i ettermiddag ved en feil utl√∏st en alarm som iverksetter tiltak mot kapringer p√• flyplassen. Ingenting har skjedd, alle passasjerer er i trygge og i fin form, og venter p√• √• fly snart, skriver selskapet i meldingen , som avsluttes med en dyp beklagelse.
Det var 27 passasjerer om bord p√• flyet.
Flytrafikken stanset
Hendelsen f√∏rte til at tungt bev√¶pnet politi, en rekke ambulanser, brannbiler og to ambulansehelikoptre rykket ut til flyplassen.
I l√∏pet av den dr√∏ye timen den antatte kapringen sto p√•, var b√•de Twitter og nederlandske medier fulle av meldinger om det mange mistenkte var en alvorlig gisselsituasjon. Hendelsen f√∏rte ogs√• til at flytrafikken ble stanset og deler av flyplassen sperret av.
If√∏lge det nederlandske nyhetsbyr√•et ANP dreide det seg om en s√•kalt Grib 3-situasjon, som inneb√¶rer at det har oppst√•tt en alvorlig situasjon som kan ha stor innvirkning p√• befolkningen.
Ogs√• statsminister Mark Rutte ble informert om utrykkingen.
Vitser p√• sosiale medier
Episoden er pinlig for Air Europa, og onsdag kveld m√•tte selskapet og den uheldige piloten t√•le en rekke vitser p√• sosiale medier om hvordan folk trykker p√• knapper de absolutt b√∏r holde seg unna
En talsmann for flyplassen, Dennis Muller, ga kort tid etter at saken var oppklart, beskjed om at all flytrafikk kunne starte igjen.
De f√∏rste meldingene gikk ut p√• at milit√¶rpolitiet rykket ut i forbindelse med ¬´en mistenkelig hendelse¬ª. Deretter ble det meldt at et stort antall utrykningskj√∏ret√∏y var blitt sendt til flyplassen, som ligger i utkanten av Amsterdam.

Saken oppdateres.
text:
False alarm led to full alarm at Schiphol in Amsterdam
A pilot pushing the wrong button contributed to the full call at Schiphol Airport in Amsterdam on Wednesday night. Air Europe apologizes deeply.
06 Nov 2019, 18:52 by NTB-AFP-AP



A plane is waiting to take off from Amsterdam Airport Schiphol Airport after the alarm went off on Wednesday night. üì∑ Photo: Giorgio Bonfiglio / AP / NTB scanpix Gallery



Dutch police in Schiphol after an accident triggered an alarm on board an aircraft from Air Europa. üì∑ Photo: Peter Dejong / AP / NTB scanpix Gallery


After an hour and a half with unconfirmed reports that a hostage situation was possibly on board an aircraft, the message came that all the passengers and crew were safe.
Shortly afterwards, Spanish airline Air Europa posted a complaint on Twitter.
- False alarm. On the flight from Amsterdam to Madrid, an alarm was triggered in the afternoon by an alarm that takes action against hijackings at the airport. Nothing has happened, all passengers are safe and in good shape, and are waiting to fly soon, the company writes in the message, which concludes with a deep regret.
There were 27 passengers on board the aircraft.
Air traffic stopped
The incident led to heavily armed police, a number of ambulances, fire trucks and two ambulance helicopters reaching the airport.
During the roughly hour of the alleged hijacking, both Twitter and Dutch media were full of reports that many suspects were seriously hostage. The incident also caused air traffic to be stopped and parts of the airport blocked off.
According to the Dutch news agency ANP, it was a so-called Grab 3 situation, which means that a serious situation has arisen that can have a major impact on the population.
Prime Minister Mark Rutte was also informed of the call.
Jokes on social media
The episode is embarrassing for Air Europa, and on Wednesday night, the company and the unlucky pilot had to endure a number of jokes on social media about how people are pushing buttons they should absolutely stay away from
A spokesman for the airport, Dennis Muller, shortly after the case was resolved, announced that all air traffic could start again.
The first reports were that the military police went out in connection with "a suspicious incident". It was then reported that a large number of emergency vehicles had been sent to the airport, located on the outskirts of Amsterdam.

The case is being updated.
